# Un-categorized useful links

- [ThreeDWorld](http://www.threedworld.org): A High-Fidelity, Multi-Modal Platform for Interactive Physical Simulation

- [De-Jargonizer](http://scienceandpublic.com/): An online tool that assesses and scores the accessibility of text.

- [International Picture Naming Project website](https://crl.ucsd.edu/experiments/ipnp/1stimuli.html): The picture stimuli set consist of black-and-white line drawings of 520 common objects and 275 transitive and intransitive actions.

- [Critical Analysis Project](http://critical-analysis.org/)

# Graphical statistical tools based on R

- [JASP](https://github.com/jasp-stats/jasp-desktop): JASP is an open-source statistics program that is free, friendly, and flexible. Armed with an easy-to-use GUI, JASP allows both classical and Bayesian analyses.

- [jamovi](https://www.jamovi.org/): jamovi is a new “3rd generation” statistical spreadsheet.

- [The R Commander](https://socialsciences.mcmaster.ca/jfox/Misc/Rcmdr/index.html): The R Commander is a graphical user interface (GUI) to the free, open-source R statistical software. The R Commander is implemented as an R package, the Rcmdr package, which is freely available on CRAN (the R package archive).

# Research groups and personal websites

## Research groups

- [Dynamics of cognition and communication](https://www.thedocc.com), lead by [Zheng (Joyce) Wang](https://www.thedocc.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/10/WangCV.pdf), at The Ohio State University, Columbus, OH.

- [Cultural Brain](https://culturalbrain.org), lead by [Falk Huettig](https://www.mpi.nl/people/huettig-falk), at Max Planck Institute for Psycholinguistics, Nijmegen, the Netherlands. 

- [The Markman Lab](http://markmanlab.stanford.edu/index.html), lead by Ellen M. Markman, at Stanford University, Stanford, CA.

- [The Language Learning Lab](http://web.sas.upenn.edu/trueswell-lab/), lead by Professor [John Trueswell](http://web.sas.upenn.edu/trueswell-lab/people/trueswell/), at University of Pennsylvania, Philadelphia, PA. 

- [Poeppel Lab](https://wp.nyu.edu/poeppellab/), lead by Professor [David Poeppel](http://as.nyu.edu/content/nyu-as/as/faculty/david-poeppel.html), at New York University, New York, NY.

- [Language & Cognitive Dynamics Laboratory](http://www.danmirman.org/Home)

- [Brain and Language Lab](https://brainlang.georgetown.edu), lead by Professor [Michael Ullman](https://georgetown.app.box.com/s/5lrbyhfe5iq07xim1b13t15tjx7m9hyl), at Georgetown University, Washington, D.C.
